title: Grievous Wounds option for AP champions
body:
{{item:3165}}  costs 2900 and gives the unique passive "Dealing magic damage to an enemy champion below 35% health inflicts Grievous Wounds to them for 8 seconds." while {{item:3123}} costs 800 and gives the unique passive "Physical damage inflicts Grievous Wounds on enemy champions for 3 seconds.". So lets take a look at these items based on their Grievous Wounds options  side by side.

--------------------------------------------------------------------{{item:3165}}---------------------------{{item:3123}}
---------------------------------------------Cost: -----------2900----------------------------800
----Grievous Wounds duration:  ----------8 seconds-------------------3 seconds
Grievous Wounds Stipulation: ---------Below 35% HP------------None

It would be great if the {{item:1052}} in {{item:3165}} was a 800 gold Grievous Wounds item called "monograph of decay" or something and then the combine cost of {{item:3165}} could be lowered by 365 gold. It really sucks if your playing an AP champion who does not use mana or a mage who does not want {{item:3165}} but it is really your only option for Grievous Wounds.

No. Grievous wounds should've been removed from the game so healing could actually be balanced properly. Rather than healing either being too strong unless grievous wounds is applied, or horribly weak when it is applied and then making champs that are dependent on healing useless.

Besides, the pool of champs that would use that is incredibly small. Most mages want Morellos. The ones that don't are either Tanky or do tons of burst dmg (and you don't really need grievous wounds if you're killing them before they have the ability to heal).
At 100 AP, 20% CDR, and mana regen on assist, Morello's is great on everyone.

same thing applies to cait, draven, and any other BS mechanic.

The point is that arguing for AD/AP versions of AP/AD items is just stupid.  It removes uniqueness from the original items, and it gets to a point when there is no need to even have AD and AP be separate things. 

The biggest strength of AP in my mind is that they are the only builds who can increase their scale exponentially.  It takes a long time to do that (my favorite Karthus build requires a lot of farm and a lot of time in the game: {{item:3027}} {{item:3040}} {{item:3089}} {{item:3020}} and then two items for utility or defense, both usually with AP) which makes them weak early.  

AD gives more damage earlier and is easier to apply (through auto attacks).  Then we have crit scaling, which boosts AD damage a lot, but only if you're going for crit builds to make it work.

ADCs are just balls of stats that scale with gold and win by right clicking. That's not an insult btw that's just what they are. Mages bring utility and burst but are gated by mana and cooldowns. They scale with levels (and gold but so does everyone.) So an AD Deathcap would be totally broken and more powerful than an AP one I'd argue. An AD hourglass is sorta similar to Hexdrinker. 

There really doesn't need to be an exact counterpart for every item but everyone should be able to apply Grievous Wounds. I've bought it as a support when my team refuses to buy it just because it's so important and only costs 800G. Morells costs a LOT of gold though and benefits every mage almost, it feels like the Grievous Wounds part is randomly tacked on. Having a cheaper item that focuses on applying Grievous Wounds for AP champions would be legit imo.

I think we should split Void Staff into two items, one that offers a GW on spell cast passive on top of the magic pen, and another that offers either a QSS passive or tenacity.
